transportAdvice: Denver has a light rail and bus rapid transit network that connects downtown and major attractions, making it reasonably easy to get around without a car in the city center. Taxis and rideshare vehicles are widely available, and the downtown 16th Street Mall area is very walkable, though a car is recommended for reaching mountain destinations.

weather.description: Cold and often sunny with occasional snow; layers are essential and mountain roads may require chains or snow tires.
Still cold with periodic snowstorms, but sunny days are common thanks to Denver's high-altitude, semi-arid climate.
Transitional month with unpredictable weather; heavy wet snowstorms are possible alongside mild, pleasant days.
Spring arrives but snow is still possible; temperatures swing widely so pack versatile clothing.
Warm and increasingly green with afternoon thunderstorms becoming more frequent as the season progresses.
Warm and sunny with afternoon thunderstorms typical; a great month for outdoor activities and hiking.
The hottest month with intense afternoon thunderstorms; mornings are ideal for outdoor excursions before storms develop.
Similar to July with warm temperatures and frequent afternoon thunderstorms; excellent for mountain and city exploration.
One of the best months to visit with mild temperatures, lower humidity, and stunning fall foliage beginning in the mountains.
Crisp and clear autumn weather with beautiful foliage; early snowfall is possible, especially at higher elevations.
Cooling rapidly with the first significant snowfalls of the season; ski resorts begin opening in the nearby mountains.
Cold and wintry with snow likely; the holiday season brings festive events downtown and excellent skiing conditions nearby.
